Question: This person organized and led marches for blacks' right to vote, desegregation, labor rights and other basic civil rights.
Hints: This person became pastor of the Dexter Avenue Baptist Church in Montgomery, Alabama, when he was twenty-five years old, in 1954.
In speaking once about how he wished to be remembered after his death, this person stated:.
This person and his wife were also awarded the Congressional Gold Medal in 2004.
